borough: London Borough of Barking and Dagenham
decision_conditions: <div>The scale, siting and design of the proposed development would result in overlooking, a loss of outlook, a loss of privacy, overlooking and a sense of overbearingness to the rear garden at no.2&nbsp;Westminster Gardens, also impacting the windows on the side elevation of no.2. As such, the proposed development constitutes unneighbourly development and is contrary to:</div><div><br></div><div><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;</span>National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March 2021);</span><o:p></o:p></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policy CP3 of&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010)<o:p></o:p></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;</span>Local Development Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March 2011)<o:p></o:p></p><p class="MsoNormal"><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="" style="line-height: 14.98px;">- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning Document (February 2012);<o:p></o:p></span></p><p class="MsoNormal"></p><p><span pt="" sans",="" sans-serif;"="">- Policies SP2, DMD1 and DMD6 of&nbsp;</span>The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021)</p></div>

<p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;">The applicant has failed to present plans which accurately
depict the&nbsp;proposed development.&nbsp;Specifically the proposed front and rear
elevations (drawing no.&nbsp;1025/SPB/RS/2) indicate a proposed 'Sound Barrier', that is not&nbsp;otherwise referred to throughout the application.&nbsp; As such, the proposal
could prejudice third parties who may otherwise have wished to comment on the
application; the proposed development and its impact on amenity&nbsp;cannot be accurately assessed, and it
cannot be demonstrated that it would be supported by the Development Plan. As
such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;</p><p>

</p><p style="margin: 0cm 0cm 7.5pt;">- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy
Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);&nbsp;- Policy D4 of the London Plan (March
2021); - Policy CP3 of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy
(July 2010);&nbsp;- Policies BP8 and BP11 of the&nbsp;Local Development
Framework (LDF) Borough Wide Development Plan Document (DPD) (March
2011);&nbsp;- The Residential Extensions and Alterations Supplementary Planning
Document (February 2012);&nbsp;- Policies SP2 and DMD1 of&nbsp;The London
Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission
Version, December 2021)<span style="font-size: 10.5pt; font-family: Helvetica, sans-serif;"><o:p></o:p></span></p>

<p><span style="font-size:11pt;">The proposed development, by reason of its bulk, form, design&nbsp;and massing, fails to accord with the surrounding local character.&nbsp;The roof form in particular is&nbsp;prominent and results in&nbsp;harm to the <span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="streetscene" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lk86z0ipuaed66puh">streetscene</span>, disrupting&nbsp;the established character and appearance of the area.The proposed development is&nbsp;contrary to:- National Planning Policy Framework (<span class="scayt-misspell-word" data-scayt-word="DLUHC" data-wsc-lang="en_US" data-wsc-id="lk86z0io9ojxj3s9m">DLUHC</span> , 2021); - Policies H2 and D4 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policies BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - Policies SP2&nbsp;and DMD1 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Submission version, December 2021).</span><br></p>

<p>The&nbsp;Environment Agency have objected in principle to the proposed development,&nbsp;as it falls within a flood risk vulnerability category that is inappropriate to the Flood Zone in which the application site is located. The application is therefore contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) and its associated Planning Practice Guidance (PPG).&nbsp;&nbsp;<span style="font-size: 11pt;">As such, the proposed development is contrary to:&nbsp;- National Planning Policy Framework&nbsp;National Planning Policy Framework (NPPF) (DLUHC, 2021);&nbsp;- Policy SI12 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policy CR4&nbsp;of the&nbsp;Local Development Framework (LDF) Core Strategy (July 2010);&nbsp;- PolicY DMSI6&nbsp;of&nbsp;The London Borough of Barking and Dagenham’s Draft Local Plan: (Regulation 19 Submission Version, December 2021); -&nbsp;</span>Planning Practice Guidance:&nbsp;Flood risk and coastal change (DLUHC, March 2014) (Updated August 2022).</p><p><br></p>

<p>The proposed external amenity arrangement is of a poor standard. The awkward arrangement presented introduces rear gardens that are disconnected from the upper floor dwellings, which will have&nbsp;limited privacy and usability.&nbsp;The rear gardens&nbsp;will offer very limited outlook and will be directly overlooked from the habitable rooms and&nbsp;balconies on the rear. elevation.&nbsp;Additionally, the balconies and rear windows themselves will be overlooked by the rear gardens, impacting the privacy at the dwellings.&nbsp;The proposed development is therefore contrary to: - National Planning Policy Framework (DLUHC , 2021); - Policies D4 and D6 of the London Plan (March 2021); - Policy CP3 of the LDF Core Strategy (July 2010); - Policies BP5, BP8 and BP11 of the LDF Borough Wide Development Plan Policies DPD (March 2011); - Policies SP2, SP3 and DMD1 of the Draft Local Plan (Regulation 19 Submission version, December 2021)</p>
description: Construction of a three story residential block to provide three 1xbed flats including planting and boundary treatments

open_spaces_details.description: The development and associated hardstanding and gardens will occupy the site.

constraints_details.result: Land Adjacent To, 2 Westminster Gardens, Barking, Barking And Dagenham, IG11 0BJ
